g.text: Do Not Cite, Quote or Distribute
Trends in average global and regional land area under specific land uses
three decades. For land use classification ‘cropland’ represe
which includes land under temporary crops, meadow, pasture and fallow. ‘Forest’ and ‘permanent
meadow and pasture’ follow FAOSTAT categories.
The indirect drivers behind how humans both use and impact
natural resources are outlined in Table
, specifically; demographic, economic and cultural, scientific and technological, and institutional
and governance drivers. These indirect drivers not only interact with each othe
al scales but are also subject to impacts and feedbacks from the direct drivers
Indirect drivers of anthropogenic land and natural resource use patterns
Global and regional trends in population growth
